t: Amazon says it’s permanently banned 600 Chinese brands for review fraud | The Verge
s: September 17, 2021 - Following the high-profile disappearances of Aukey, Mpow, RavPower, Choetech and more, Amazon now says it’s cracked down on 3,000 seller accounts across 600 Chinese brands over the past five months.

t: Amazon: Why Amazon has permanently banned 600 Chinese brands - Times of India
s: September 18, 2021 - While the names of all brands aren’t known, some of them include really popular ones in China. Aukey Mpow, RavPower, Vava are some of the ‘big’ brands that have been permanently banned by Amazon.

t: Amazon
s: I have been selling this brand for over 10+ years. I was notified today by Amazon that I will no longer be able to sell the brand or even be able to apply to sell the brand. I believe this is targeted at my account.

t: Amazon Bans 600 Chinese Brands For Fake Reviews | Nasdaq
s: The banned vendors include Aukey, Mpow, RavPower, Vava, TaoTronics and Choetech. The South China Morning Post reported the news earlier, citing an interview with Cindy Tai, Amazon's Vice President of Asia Global Selling.

t: We bought gadgets from Amazon’s banned brands and it was a piece of cake | The Verge
s: October 1, 2021 - Banned Amazon-first gadget brands RavPower, Vava, TaoTronics and Choetech snuck back onto the Amazon storefront, dodging their bans. Amazon is trying to remove them.

s: Ray-Ban brand store on Amazon

t: Amazon has banned over 600 Chinese brands as part of review fraud crackdown
s: September 18, 2021 - The crackdown began in earnest five months earlier, but it received wider attention when Amazon banned Aukey and Mpow. The venders were caught offering rewards, including gift cards, for customers leaving reviews. Amazon later booted RAVPower, Vava and other relatively well-known brands for ...

t: Amazon Ban | Amazon Seller Account Suspended
s: July 7, 2019 - Additionally, relisting an item ... possibly banned. Amazon has a counterfeit problem. A recent study by the Government Accountability Office (GAO) found that 20 out of 47 products bought in the online marketplaces of Amazon, eBay Walmart, Sears and Newegg were counterfeit items. This means over 40 percent of the GAO’s purchases were knockoff items sold under another brand’s ...

t: Amazon
s: I have received this on Amazon brand registery but it is not at all clear what i have supposedly done wrong.

t: Amazon permanently banned over 600 Chinese brands for repeated violation of its policies: Report - The Hindu BusinessLine
s: December 5, 2021 - Amazon has permanently banned more than 600 Chinese brands across 3,000 different seller accounts, according to reports.

t: Here are the brands Amazon banished — and here are some great alternatives | Android Central
s: July 22, 2021 - Since then, Amazon has been seen removing more brands from its site. The company gave a statement on how it takes the integrity of its website very seriously. "To help earn the trust of customers, we devote significant resources to preventing fake or incentivized reviews from appearing in our store." That said, companies that have been removed from the site can appeal the decision, granted they agree to follow Amazon's policy. So far, these are the companies that have been banned ...

t: Amazon bans 3 more Chinese brands amid crackdown on fake reviews - Hindustan Times
s: June 22, 2021 - Citing the Guangdong SACA Precision Manufacturing, South China Morning Post (SCMP) reported that Amazon has banned the sale of RAVPower power banks, Taotronics earphones and VAVA cameras, three brands under Shenzhen-based electronics company Sunvalley, effective from June 16.

t: Where do people who have been banned from Amazon shop online? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 2): What would you do if Wal-Mart banned you? You’ll shop at literally any other place that’s not Wal-Mart. There are tons of online retailers to shop from. Honestly, in many cases, when I find an item on Amazon, I look for the seller’s name and often they have their own ...

s: June 23, 2021 - Amid e-commerce giant Amazon's ongoing crackdown on attempts by sellers to solicit positive consumer reviews, three more Chinese consumer brands have been banned from selling on the platform

t: Amazon bans three more Chinese brands for soliciting fake reviews
s: June 21, 2021 - Three brands under Shenzhen-based Sunvalley were banned from Amazon’s online site after they allegedly offered gift cards to customers who wrote positive product reviews.
